# The clifford package: Clifford algebra in R

![](reference/figures/clifford.png)

To cite the `clifford` package in publications please use Hankin (2025).
The `clifford` package provides R-centric functionality for working with
Clifford algebras of arbitrary dimension and signature. A detailed
vignette is provided in the package.

# Installation

You can install the released version of the clifford package from
[CRAN](https://CRAN.R-project.org) with:

``` r
# install.packages("clifford")  # uncomment this to install the package
library("clifford")
set.seed(0)
```

# The `clifford` package in use

The basic creation function is
[`clifford()`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/clifford.md),
which takes a list of basis blades and a vector of coefficients:

``` r
(a <- clifford(list(1,2,1:4,2:3),1:4))
#> Element of a Clifford algebra, equal to
#> + 1e_1 + 2e_2 + 4e_23 + 3e_1234
(b <- clifford(list(2,2:3,1:2),c(-2,3,-3)))
#> Element of a Clifford algebra, equal to
#> - 2e_2 - 3e_12 + 3e_23
```

So `a` and `b` are multivectors. Clifford objects are a vector space and
we can add them using `+`:

``` r
a+b
#> Element of a Clifford algebra, equal to
#> + 1e_1 - 3e_12 + 7e_23 + 3e_1234
```

See how the `e2` term vanishes and the `e_23` term is summed. The
package includes a large number of products:

``` r
a*b        # geometric product (also "a % % b")
#> Element of a Clifford algebra, equal to
#> - 16 + 6e_1 - 3e_2 - 2e_12 + 14e_3 + 12e_13 + 3e_123 - 9e_14 + 9e_34 - 6e_134
a %^% b    # outer product
#> Element of a Clifford algebra, equal to
#> - 2e_12 + 3e_123
a %.% b    # inner product
#> Element of a Clifford algebra, equal to
#> - 16 + 6e_1 - 3e_2 + 14e_3 - 9e_14 + 9e_34 - 6e_134
a %star% b # scalar product
#> [1] -16
a %euc% b  # Euclidean product
#> [1] 8
```

The package can deal with non positive-definite inner products. Suppose
we wish to deal with an inner product of

where the diagonal is a number of terms followed by a number of terms.
The package idiom for this would be to use
[`signature()`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/signature.md):

``` r
signature(3)
```

Function
[`signature()`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/signature.md)
is based on
[`lorentz::sol()`](https://robinhankin.github.io/lorentz/reference/sol.html)
and its argument specifies the number of basis blades that square to ,
the others squaring to . Thus and :

``` r
basis(1)
#> Element of a Clifford algebra, equal to
#> + 1e_1
basis(1)^2
#> Element of a Clifford algebra, equal to
#> scalar ( 1 )
basis(4)
#> Element of a Clifford algebra, equal to
#> + 1e_4
basis(4)^2
#> Element of a Clifford algebra, equal to
#> the zero clifford element (0)
```

The package uses the STL map class with dynamic bitset keys for
efficiency and speed and can deal with objects of arbitrary dimensions.
Thus:

``` r
options("basissep" = ",")
(x <- rcliff(d=20))
#> Element of a Clifford algebra, equal to
#> + 5 - 1e_2 + 6e_5 + 2e_4,7 - 3e_10 - 5e_11 + 3e_14 + 1e_10,14 + 4e_5,9,15 +
#> 9e_18,19
summary(x^3)
#> Element of a Clifford algebra 
#> Typical terms:  140  ...  + 216e_5,9,10,14,15,18,19 
#> Number of terms: 44 
#> Magnitude: 25376
```

# Further information

For more detail, see the package vignette

`vignette("clifford")`

which is the canonical vignette. However, other vignettes are available:
which is the canonical vignette. However,

- `complex_clifford`,

which is the canonical vignette. Other vignettes are included in the
package:

- `complex_clifford`
- `conformal_algebra_clifford`
- `cramer_clifford` \[possibly not on CRAN, only the github repo\]
- `determinants_clifford`
- `dual_quaternion_clifford`
- `getcoeffs`
- `lorentz_clifford`
- `pauli_clifford`
- `pseudoscalar`
- `quaternion_clifford` \[possibly not on CRAN, only the github repo\]
- `signature`

# References

- R. K. S. Hankin 2025. *Clifford algebra in R: introducing the clifford
  package*. *Advances in Clifford Algebra*, volume 35, number 51.
  [doi:10.1007/s00006-025-01403-9](https://doi.org/10.1007/s00006-025-01403-9).
- D. Hestenes 1987. *Clifford algebra to geometric calculus*, Kluwer.
- J. Snygg 2010. *A new approach to differential geometry using
  Clifford’s geometric algebra*. Berghauser.
- C. Perwass 2009. *Geometric algebra with applications in engineering*.
  Springer.

# Package index

## All functions

- [`` `[`( ``*`<clifford>`*`)`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/Extract.md)
  [`` `[<-`( ``*`<clifford>`*`)`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/Extract.md)
  [`coeffs()`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/Extract.md)
  [`` `coeffs<-`() ``](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/Extract.md)
  [`list_modifier()`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/Extract.md)
  [`getcoeffs()`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/Extract.md)
  [`Im(`*`<clifford>`*`)`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/Extract.md)
  [`Re(`*`<clifford>`*`)`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/Extract.md)
  : Extract or Replace Parts of a clifford

- [`Ops(`*`<clifford>`*`)`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/Ops.clifford.md)
  [`clifford_negative()`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/Ops.clifford.md)
  [`geoprod()`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/Ops.clifford.md)
  [`clifford_times_scalar()`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/Ops.clifford.md)
  [`clifford_plus_clifford()`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/Ops.clifford.md)
  [`clifford_eq_clifford()`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/Ops.clifford.md)
  [`clifford_inverse()`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/Ops.clifford.md)
  [`cliffdotprod()`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/Ops.clifford.md)
  [`fatdot()`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/Ops.clifford.md)
  [`lefttick()`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/Ops.clifford.md)
  [`righttick()`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/Ops.clifford.md)
  [`wedge()`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/Ops.clifford.md)
  [`scalprod()`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/Ops.clifford.md)
  [`eucprod()`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/Ops.clifford.md)
  [`maxyterm()`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/Ops.clifford.md)
  [`` `%.%` ``](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/Ops.clifford.md)
  [`` `%dot%` ``](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/Ops.clifford.md)
  [`` `%^%` ``](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/Ops.clifford.md)
  [`` `%X%` ``](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/Ops.clifford.md)
  [`` `%star%` ``](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/Ops.clifford.md)
  [`` `% %` ``](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/Ops.clifford.md)
  [`` `%euc%` ``](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/Ops.clifford.md)
  [`` `%o%` ``](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/Ops.clifford.md)
  [`` `%_|%` ``](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/Ops.clifford.md)
  [`` `%|_%` ``](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/Ops.clifford.md)
  :

  Arithmetic Ops Group Methods for `clifford` objects

- [`allcliff()`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/allcliff.md)
  : Clifford object containing all possible terms

- [`antivector()`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/antivector.md)
  [`as.antivector()`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/antivector.md)
  [`is.antivector()`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/antivector.md)
  : Antivectors or pseudovectors

- [`cartan()`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/cartan.md)
  [`cartan_inverse()`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/cartan.md)
  : Cartan map between clifford algebras

- [`clifford-package`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/clifford-package.md)
  : Arbitrary Dimensional Clifford Algebras

- [`clifford()`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/clifford.md)
  [`is_ok_clifford()`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/clifford.md)
  [`as.clifford()`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/clifford.md)
  [`is.clifford()`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/clifford.md)
  [`nbits()`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/clifford.md)
  [`nterms()`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/clifford.md)
  [`dim(`*`<clifford>`*`)`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/clifford.md)
  :

  Create, coerce, and test for `clifford` objects

- [`const()`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/const.md)
  [`is.real()`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/const.md)
  [`` `const<-`( ``*`<clifford>`*`)`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/const.md)
  : The constant term of a Clifford object

- [`dot`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/dot.md)

- [`is.homog()`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/homog.md)
  : Homogenous Clifford objects

- [`horner()`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/horner.md)
  : Horner's method

- [`rev(`*`<clifford>`*`)`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/involution.md)
  [`Conj(`*`<clifford>`*`)`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/involution.md)
  [`cliffconj()`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/involution.md)

  [`gradeinv()`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/involution.md)
  : Clifford involutions

- [`c_identity()`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/lowlevel.md)
  [`c_grade()`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/lowlevel.md)
  [`c_add()`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/lowlevel.md)

  [`c_power()`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/lowlevel.md)
  [`c_equal()`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/lowlevel.md)
  [`c_overwrite()`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/lowlevel.md)
  [`c_cartan()`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/lowlevel.md)
  [`c_cartan_inverse()`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/lowlevel.md)
  :

  Low-level helper functions for `clifford` objects

- [`Mod(`*`<clifford>`*`)`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/magnitude.md)
  : Magnitude of a clifford object

- [`minus()`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/minus.md)
  : Take the negative of a vector

- [`numeric_to_clifford()`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/numeric_to_clifford.md)
  [`as.1vector()`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/numeric_to_clifford.md)
  [`is.1vector()`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/numeric_to_clifford.md)
  [`scalar()`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/numeric_to_clifford.md)
  [`as.scalar()`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/numeric_to_clifford.md)
  [`is.scalar()`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/numeric_to_clifford.md)
  [`basis()`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/numeric_to_clifford.md)
  [`e()`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/numeric_to_clifford.md)
  : Coercion from numeric to Clifford form

- [`print(`*`<clifford>`*`)`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/print.md)
  [`as.character(`*`<clifford>`*`)`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/print.md)
  [`catterm()`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/print.md)
  : Print clifford objects

- [`pseudoscalar()`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/pseudoscalar.md)
  [`is.pseudoscalar()`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/pseudoscalar.md)
  : Coercion from numeric to Clifford form

- [`quaternion`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/quaternion.md)
  [`quaternion_to_clifford`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/quaternion.md)
  [`clifford_to_quaternion`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/quaternion.md)
  : Quaternions using Clifford algebras

- [`rcliff()`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/rcliff.md)
  [`rclifff()`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/rcliff.md)
  [`rblade()`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/rcliff.md)
  : Random clifford objects

- [`signature()`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/signature.md)
  [`is_ok_sig()`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/signature.md)
  [`showsig()`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/signature.md)
  [`print(`*`<sigobj>`*`)`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/signature.md)
  : The signature of the Clifford algebra

- [`summary(`*`<clifford>`*`)`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/summary.md)
  [`print(`*`<summary.clifford>`*`)`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/summary.md)
  [`first_n_last()`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/summary.md)
  : Summary methods for clifford objects

- [`terms()`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/term.md)
  [`is.blade()`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/term.md)
  [`is.basisblade()`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/term.md)
  : Deal with terms

- [`as.vector(`*`<clifford>`*`)`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/vector.md)
  : Coerce a clifford vector to a numeric vector

- [`zap()`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/zap.md) :
  Zap small values in a clifford object

- [`is.zero()`](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/reference/zero.md)
  : The zero Clifford object

# Articles

### All vignettes

- [Complex arithmetic using Clifford
  algebra](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/articles/complex_clifford.md):
- [Conformal geometry with Clifford
  algebra](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/articles/conformal_algebra_clifford.md):
- [Cramer's rule in civilised form with Clifford
  algebra](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/articles/cramer_clifford.md):
- [Determinants using Clifford
  algebra](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/articles/determinants_clifford.md):
- [Dual quaternions via Clifford
  algebra](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/articles/dual_quaternion_clifford.md):
- [Function \`getcoeffs()\` in the \`clifford\`
  package](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/articles/getcoeffs.md):
- [Lorentz transforms via Clifford
  algebra](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/articles/lorentz_clifford.md):
- [Pauli matrices via Clifford
  algebra](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/articles/pauli_clifford.md):
- [Function \`pseudoscalar()\` in the \`clifford\`
  package](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/articles/pseudoscalar.md):
- [Quaternionic arithmetic with Clifford
  algebra](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/articles/quaternion_clifford.md):
- [Function \`signature()\` in the \`clifford\`
  package](https://robinhankin.github.io/clifford/articles/signature.md):
